lv.emes.libraries.communication.db

Interface MS_IJDBCDatabase

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MS_JDBCDatabase, MS_MySQLDatabase

    public interface MS_IJDBCDatabase
    Describes main functions of JDBC database.
    Version:
    1.1.
    Author:
    eMeS

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Commits executed statement.

      Closing connecting to DB.

      Prepares statement for given SQL query.
      MS_PreparedStatement prepareQueryWithThrows(java.lang.String sql)
      Just like executeQuery, but if exception occurs, it isn't handled silently, using "onError" methods.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect()
      throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
             java.sql.SQLException
        Connects to DB using public connection variables.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if couldn't connect to DB.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if JDBC driver not found.

      • connect

        void connect(java.lang.String hostname,
             java.lang.String dbName,
             int port,
             java.lang.String userName,
             java.lang.String password)
      throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
             java.sql.SQLException
        Connects to given DB.
        Parameters:
        hostname - "localhost", "http://emesserver.ddns.net", "128.156.244.123", etc.
        dbName - if not used, leave null or "", if used - database name.
        port - number of port to DB connection.
        userName - DB user name.
        password - DB password.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if JDBC driver failed to load.
        java.sql.SQLException - if connecting to given DB failed.

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Closing connecting to DB.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if couldn't do disconnect.

      • getIsConnected

        boolean getIsConnected()
        Checks, if the connection to DB is established.
        Returns:
        true if connected.

      • prepareQuery

        MS_PreparedStatement prepareQuery(java.lang.String sql)
        Prepares statement for given SQL query. Exception handling is done silently (you don't need to handle those exceptions every time, just set common error handling operations of JDBCDatabase)
        Parameters:
        sql - an SQL statement that may contain one or more '?' IN parameter placeholders
        Returns:
        a new default MS_PreparedStatement object containing the pre-compiled SQL statement
        See Also:
        MS_JDBCDatabase

      • prepareQueryWithThrows

        MS_PreparedStatement prepareQueryWithThrows(java.lang.String sql)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Just like executeQuery, but if exception occurs, it isn't handled silently, using "onError" methods. So use this method if you want to instantly handle errors using individual approach for some case!
        Parameters:
        sql - an SQL statement that may contain one or more '?' IN parameter placeholders
        Returns:
        a new default MS_PreparedStatement object containing the pre-compiled SQL statement
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection
        See Also:
        prepareQuery(java.lang.String)

      • getQueryResult

        java.sql.ResultSet getQueryResult(MS_PreparedStatement statement)
        Gets the result of executed statement. Example of use (executes given statement and prints out first column of result as String):

        ResultSet ress = db.getQueryResult(statement);
        while (ress.next()) {
        System.out.println(ress.getString(1)); //columns are starting with 1
        }

        Parameters:
        statement - proper SQL statement which have been executed as SELECT type statement.
        Returns:
        ResultSet

      • commitStatement

        boolean commitStatement(MS_PreparedStatement statement)
        Commits executed statement.
        Parameters:
        statement - a already executed statement to commit.
        Returns:
        true, if success, false - if failed to commit for some reason.

      • getConnection

        java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        Returns:
        reference to current connection.
